sections.title: Acknowledge
sections.instruction: First, try to notice what you're feeling without changing it. Let's say you make a mistake at work and immediately start experiencing intense self-hatred. Instead of pushing the feeling away or attacking yourself, try to observe your emotions, thoughts, and urges: 'I'm noticing that I'm feeling shame and self-hatred right now. My chest feels tight, and my thoughts are getting really dark.'
sections.placeholder: What are you noticing right now? Describe your emotions, physical sensations, and thoughts without trying to change them...

subsections.title: Accept Emotion
subsections.instruction: Allow yourself to experience the emotion and tell yourself that it is okay that you are having this experience. You may tell yourself, 'I have experienced strong emotions before. I don't like how I feel, but it won't hurt me.' Or even something as simple as 'This is how I feel right now.'
subsections.placeholder: How can you accept this emotion without trying to fix or change it? What would you tell yourself to allow these feelings to be present?

subsections.title: Understand Emotion
subsections.instruction: Try to look for the understandable part. Even if you don't like the feeling, try to see how it makes sense given your history and circumstances: 'Of course, I'm feeling this way - I grew up believing I had to be perfect to be worthy of love. Anyone with my experiences might feel similar.' or 'This self-hatred feels overwhelming right now, and that makes sense given everything I've been through. My feelings are valid responses to real experiences.'
subsections.placeholder: How does this emotional response make sense given your history, values, and circumstances? Why is it understandable that you would feel this way?

sections.title: Respond
sections.instruction: What evidence contradicts this negative thought? Include times when the opposite was true.

subsections.title: Offer Compassion
subsections.instruction: Respond to yourself with the same compassion you would offer a good friend. What would you say to comfort and support yourself in this moment? How can you treat yourself with kindness and understanding?
subsections.placeholder: How can you offer yourself compassion right now? What kind words or actions would help you feel supported and cared for?
